data.title: Soybeans set for biggest monthly gain in nearly four years on China trade optimism
data.description:
By Tom Polansek

U.S. soybean futures were on course for their biggest monthly gain in nearly four years on Friday following a rally fuelled by the prospect of revived exports to China, traders said.

Prices remained near a 15-month high reached on Thursday after U.S. officials said China, the world's biggest soy importer, would buy tens of millions of tons of American crops in the next few years as part of a trade deal.

In the near term, U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said China agreed to buy 12 million metric tons of U.S. soybeans through January.

"This is going to be something where we should see sales almost every other day," said Rich Nelson, chief strategist for Allendale.

Bessent said China also agreed to buy 25 million metric tons of U.S. soybeans annually for the next three years. That commitment fell short of U.S. exports to China in recent years. However, it likely exceeds what China would have bought, as it has been shifting its purchases to top-exporter Brazil, Nelson said.

"Realistically, within two years, we'd be easily under 20 million tons, if not moving into the 18 million ton timeframe," Nelson said. "Compared with where we would be, this is a positive development."

The most-active soybean contract on the Chicago Board of Trade was up 3-3/4 cents at $11.11-1/2 a bushel as of 12:35 p.m. CDT (1735 GMT). The market was on track for its strongest monthly advance since January 2022.

CBOT corn and wheat futures also edged higher, though Washington and Beijing did not announce specific trade commitments for those crops.

Corn rose 1 cent to $4.31-1/4 a bushel while wheat advanced 7 cents to $5.31-1/4 a bushel.

Traders remained cautious over how China's soybean purchasing pledge will translate into actual U.S. exports.

"Confirmation from China is still pending," Commerzbank analysts said. "Until this happens, the upside potential for soybean prices is likely to be limited."

data.title: REG - Picton Property Inc. - Total Voting Rights
data.description:
RNS Number : 7808F Picton Property Income Limited 31 October 2025  

31 October 2025

PICTON PROPERTY INCOME LIMITED

('Picton' or the 'Company')

Total Voting Rights

In accordance with the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules, the Company confirms that, as at the close of business on 31 October 2025, its issued share capital consisted of 520,197,000 Ordinary Shares of no par value.

There are no shares held in Treasury.

Accordingly, the total number of shares with voting rights in Picton Property Income Limited as at 31 October 2025 is 520,197,000.

This figure may be used by shareholders as the denominator for calculations by which they will determine if they are required to notify the Company and the FCA of their interest in, or change to their interest in, Picton Property Income Limited under the Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

For further information:

Picton

Kathy Thompson, Company Secretary

020 7011 9988, kathy.thompson@picton.co.uk

About Picton

Established in 2005, Picton is listed on the main market of the London Stock Exchange and is a constituent of a number of EPRA indices including the FTSE EPRA Nareit Global Index.

Picton owns and actively manages a £726 million UK commercial property portfolio, invested across 47 assets and with around 350 occupiers (as at 30 June 2025).

Through an occupier focused, opportunity led approach, Picton aims to be the consistently best performing diversified UK REIT and has delivered upper quartile outperformance and a consistently higher income return than the MSCI UK Quarterly Property Index since launch. 

With a portfolio strategically positioned to capture income and capital growth, currently weighted towards the industrial sector, Picton's agile business model provides flexibility to adapt to evolving market trends over the long-term.

Picton has a responsible approach to business and is committed to being net zero carbon by 2040.

For more information please visit:www.picton.co.uk

LEI: 213800RYE59K9CKR4497

ENDS

data.title: Erie Indemnity Down Nearly 7%, on Track for Lowest Close Since November 2023 — Data Talk
data.description:
Erie Indemnity Company Class A (ERIE) is currently at $289.00, down $20.64 or 6.67%

  • Would be lowest close since Nov. 29, 2023, when it closed at $286.97
  • On pace for largest percent decrease since April 25, 2025, when it fell 11.47%
  • Currently down three of the past four days
  • Down 10.99% this week; worst weekly performance since the week ending April 25, 2025, when it fell 11.95%
  • Down 9.17% month-to-date
  • Down 29.89% year-to-date; on pace for worst year on record (Based on available data back to Oct. 2, 1995)
  • Down 46.96% from its all-time closing high of $544.84 on Sept. 24, 2024
  • Down 30.39% from 52 weeks ago (Nov. 1, 2024), when it closed at $415.18
  • Down 35.86% from its 52-week closing high of $450.61 on March 10, 2025
  • Would be a new 52-week closing low
  • Traded as low as $287.48; lowest intraday level since Nov. 29, 2023, when it hit $282.27
  • Down 7.16% at today's intraday low; largest intraday percent decrease since April 25, 2025, when it fell as much as 14.43%
  • Fourth worst performer in the S&P 500 today
  • Ninth least active stock in the S&P 500 today

All data as of 1:51:58 PM ET

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

data.title: Top US sanctions official to travel to Middle East, Europe to discuss 'maximum pressure' on Iran
data.description:
By Daphne Psaledakis

The U.S. Treasury Department's top sanctions official will travel to the Middle East and Europe on Friday, according to a statement seen by Reuters, as President Donald Trump's administration seeks to increase pressure on Iran.

John Hurley, undersecretary for terrorism and financial intelligence, will travel in the coming days to Israel, the United Arab Emirates, Turkey and Lebanon, according to the statement, in his first trip to the Middle East since taking office.

After taking office for his second term, Trump restored his "maximum pressure" campaign on Iran, which includes efforts to prevent Tehran from developing a nuclear weapon. In June, the U.S. bombed Iran's nuclear sites.

"President Trump has made clear that Iran's destabilizing and terrorist activities must be met with sustained and coordinated pressure," Hurley said in the statement.

"I look forward to meeting with our partners to coordinate our efforts to deny Tehran and its proxies the financial access they rely on to evade international sanctions, fund violence, and undermine stability in the region."

Iran's mission to the United Nations in New York did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

UN REINSTATED ARMS EMBARGO IN SEPTEMBER

In his first term, Trump withdrew the U.S. from a 2015 deal between Iran and world powers that placed strict limits on Tehran's uranium enrichment activities in exchange for sanctions relief.

In September, the United Nations reinstated an arms embargo and other sanctions on Iran over its nuclear program.

Western powers accuse Iran of having a clandestine agenda to develop nuclear weapons capability by enriching uranium to a high level of fissile purity, above what they say is justifiable for a civilian atomic energy program. Tehran says its nuclear program is wholly for civilian power purposes.

While in Israel, Hurley will discuss furthering Trump's maximum pressure campaign against Tehran, particularly against its regional proxies, according to the statement. Pressure against Iran will also be high on the agenda in the UAE, along with combating money laundering and the financing of terrorism.

In Turkey, the Treasury official will discuss how the two countries can "work together to stop regional malign influences and sanctions evasion."

Under former President Joe Biden's administration, the U.S. had raised concerns about poor sanctions compliance in the UAE.

data.title: REG - Guardian Metal Rsrc. - Exercise of Options
data.description:
RNS Number : 7809F Guardian Metal Resources PLC 31 October 2025  

31 October 2025

Guardian Metal Resources plc ("Guardian Metal" or the "Company")

Exercise of Options Warrants

Guardian Metal Resources plc (LON:GMET/OTCQB:GMTLF), a tungsten exploration and development company, announces that the Company has received notices to exercise Options over a total 300,000 new ordinary shares of 1 pence each in the Company ("Option Shares") raising £68,000 for the Company.

ADMISSION AND TOTAL VOTING RIGHTS

Application will be made for the 300,000 Option Shares to be admitted to trading on AIM which is expected to occur on or around 6 November 2025 ("Admission"). The Option Shares will rank pari passu in all respects with the ordinary shares of the Company currently traded on AIM.

Following Admission, the Company's issued share capital will comprise 167,898,967 ordinary shares of 1p each. This number will represent the total voting rights in the Company and may be used by shareholders as the denominator for the calculation by which they can determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the Financial Conduct Authority's Disclosure and Transparency Rules.

data.title: Standex International Corporation Reports Fiscal First Quarter 2026 Financial Results
data.description:
Standex International Corporation, a multi-industry manufacturer, has released its financial results for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026, ending September 30, 2025. The company operates in five broad business segments: Electronics, Engineering Technologies, Scientific, Engraving, and Specialty Solutions.

Financial Highlights

Standex reported a significant increase in sales and operating margins for the first quarter of fiscal year 2026. Key financial metrics include:

  • Net sales increased by 27.6% year-over-year (YOY) to $217.4 million.
  • GAAP operating margin was 13.6%, while the adjusted operating margin was 19.1%, up 210 basis points YOY.
  • Orders reached approximately $226 million, marking a record quarterly order intake.
  • Net income from continuing operations on a GAAP basis was $15.8 million, a decrease of 13.0% YOY.
  • Adjusted net income from continuing operations was $24.0 million, up 9.9% YOY.
  • EBITDA was $39.7 million, a 27.3% increase YOY, while adjusted EBITDA was $47.1 million, up 38.2% YOY.
  • Diluted EPS on a GAAP basis was $1.25, down 18.3% YOY, while adjusted diluted EPS was $1.99, up 8.2% YOY.

Business and Operational Highlights

Standex's business performance was driven by strong sales in new products and fast growth markets. Key operational highlights include:

  • Sales from new products grew by over 35%, contributing approximately 7% to total sales.
  • Sales into fast growth markets contributed around 30% of total sales, amounting to approximately $62 million in the fiscal first quarter.
  • The Electronics segment saw a 42.2% increase in revenue YOY, driven by acquisitions and strategic growth investments.
  • The Engineering Technologies segment experienced a 45.6% increase in revenue YOY, with strong demand in space, defense, and aviation end markets.
  • The Scientific segment reported a 9.9% increase in revenue YOY, despite lower demand at academic and research institutions.
  • The Engraving segment saw a 7.4% increase in revenue YOY, with improved demand in Europe.
  • The Specialty Solutions segment reported a 2.6% increase in revenue YOY, reflecting improved demand in the Hydraulics business.

Strategic Initiatives and Corporate Developments

Standex has undertaken several strategic initiatives and corporate developments:

  • The company paid down approximately $8 million of debt in the fiscal first quarter, reducing the net debt to EBITDA ratio to 2.4x.
  • Standex declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.34 per share, an increase of approximately 6.3% YOY.
  • Capital expenditures for the fiscal first quarter were $6.4 million, with expectations for fiscal year 2026 capital expenditures between $33 million and $38 million.
  • The company announced the closure of four sites, optimizing its footprint in the United Kingdom, U.S., Italy, and China, projected to yield approximately $5 million in annualized cost savings.

Management's Perspective

David Dunbar, President and CEO, commented on the strong start to the fiscal year, highlighting the record quarterly order intake and significant sales growth. He emphasized the company's focus on new product launches, strong tailwinds in key markets, and continued productivity actions.

Future Outlook

Standex has raised its fiscal year 2026 sales outlook, now expecting revenue to grow by over $110 million. The company anticipates mid-to-high-single-digit organic growth in Electronics, double-digit organic growth in Engineering Technologies, and significant contributions from recent acquisitions. Sales from fast growth markets are expected to grow over 45% YOY and exceed $270 million.

Original SEC Filing: STANDEX INTERNATIONAL CORP/DE/ [ SXI ] - 8-K - Oct. 31, 2025

Disclaimer
This is an AI-powered summary. It may contain inaccuracies. Consider verifying important information with the source. Please note this summary is solely based on documents filed with the SEC.

data.title: Kansas City Life Insur 3Q Rev $123.8M >KCLI
Kansas City Life Insur 3Q Net $3.15M >KCLI
Kansas City Life Insur 3Q EPS 33c >KCLI
Kansas City Life Announces Third Quarter 2025 Results
data.description:
(17:55 GMT) *Kansas City Life Insur 3Q EPS 33c >KCLI
(17:55 GMT) *Kansas City Life Insur 3Q Net $3.15M >KCLI
(17:55 GMT) *Kansas City Life Insur 3Q Rev $123.8M >KCLI
(17:55 GMT) Press Release: Kansas City Life Announces Third Quarter 2025 Results

KANSAS CITY, Oct. 31, 2025 /PRNewswire/ — Kansas City Life Insurance Company recorded net income of $3.2 million or $0.33 per share in the third quarter of 2025, up from net income of $1.3 million or $0.14 per share in the third quarter of 2024. The improvement in net income in the third quarter of 2025 reflected higher investment revenues and lower policyholder benefits, which was largely driven by a decline in death benefits, net of reinsurance. These improvements were partially offset by a decrease in insurance revenues.

We recorded a net loss of $23.0 million or $2.38 per share in the first nine months of 2025 compared to net income of $7.6 million or $0.79 per share in the first nine months of 2024. The primary factor in the decrease in net income in the first nine months of 2025 was the establishment of a legal settlement accrual of $35.5 million, net of tax, in the second quarter related to a potential settlement of class action lawsuits. Excluding this legal settlement accrual, net income would have been $12.5 million or $1.29 per share in the first nine months of 2025. After excluding the legal settlement accrual, the increase over the first nine months of 2024 was primarily due to lower policyholder benefits. Partially offsetting this was a decrease in insurance revenues.

Kansas City Life Insurance Company was established in 1895 and is based in Kansas City, Missouri. The Company's primary business is providing financial protection through the sale of life insurance and annuities. The Company operates in 49 states and the District of Columbia. For more information, please visit www.kclife.com.

A Condensed Consolidated Income Statement appears on the next page.

 
               Kansas City Life Insurance Company 
             Condensed Consolidated Income Statement

data.title: Entergy increases quarterly dividend payment to shareholders
data.description:
(17:48 GMT) *Entergy Increases Quarterly Dividend Payment To Shareholders >ETR
(17:48 GMT) Press Release: Entergy increases quarterly dividend payment to shareholders

NEW ORLEANS, Oct. 31, 2025 /PRNewswire/ — Entergy's board of directors today declared a quarterly dividend payment of $0.64 per share, an increase of $0.04 per share, on the company's common stock. The dividend is payable Dec. 1, 2025, to shareholders of record as of Nov. 13, 2025.

Entergy has paid shareholders a cash dividend on its common stock continuously since 1988.

About Entergy

Entergy produces, transmits and distributes electricity to power life for 3 million customers through our operating companies in Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas. We're investing for growth and improved reliability and resilience of our energy system while working to keep energy rates affordable for our customers. We're also investing in cleaner energy generation like modern natural gas, nuclear and renewable energy. A nationally recognized leader in sustainability and corporate citizenship, we deliver more than $100 million in economic benefits each year to the communities we serve through philanthropy, volunteerism and advocacy. Entergy is a Fortune 500 company headquartered in New Orleans, Louisiana, and has approximately 12,000 employees. Learn more at Entergy.com and connect with @Entergy on social media.

View original content to download multimedia:https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/entergy-increases-quarterly-dividend-payment-to-shareholders-302601335.html

SOURCE Entergy Corporation

(17:49 GMT) *Entergy Raises Dividend to 64c Vs. 60c

data.title: Entergy Increases Quarterly Dividend Payment To Shareholders >ETR
Who Needs Chipotle? Brew Pub Chain BJ's Restaurants Soars After Earnings. — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Paul R. La Monica

Consumers may no longer have a hankering for burritos, chips, and guac, but they are apparently hungry for burgers, deep dish pizzas, and craft beer.

BJ's Restaurants, which owns a casual dining chain featuring a brewhouse menu, soared nearly 20% Friday after reporting earnings on Thursday that topped Wall Street's forecasts.

Contrast that with Chipotle Mexican Grill, whose shares plunged nearly 20% Thursday due to a weaker-than-expected outlook. For some diners, Chipotle might look overpriced. BJ's, meanwhile, has a bargain offering helping it to attract more budget-conscious consumers.

BJ's touted the success of its Pizookie Meal Deal, which lets customers order one of eight entrees while also getting a deep-dish cookie (the namesake Pizookie) for $13. Analysts are optimistic the value offering will continue to bring in more customers, too.

Jefferies analyst Alexander Slagle said in a report Friday the Pizookie Meal Deal is showing encouraging momentum. Slagle added the deal also seems to be a hit across income and age groups. That's key at a time when persistent inflation is a concern for older and younger consumers regardless of how wealthy they are.

Slagle has a target of $50 on the stock, 47% higher than its current price. That makes him the most bullish analyst covering the shares. In fact, Wall Street is still skeptical that BJ's will be able to stand out in a crowded and competitive casual dining landscape. Slagle is one of only two analysts with a Buy recommendation on BJ's. Six rate it a Hold and one analyst dubs it an outright Sell.

But some of the skeptics are starting to succumb to the allure of the Pizookie. William Blair's Sharon Zackfia, who has a Market Perform rating (essentially a Hold) on the stock, said in a report Friday she was impressed "traffic accelerated to 3.5% over the past six weeks, bucking the trends of the broader restaurant space on continued growth in the Pizookie Meal Deal."

Todd Brooks, an analyst with The Benchmark Company, also has a Buy rating for BJ's and said in a report the company has found success "with a more digitally forward approach to brand marketing," including social media influencers and other word-of-mouth campaigns. Brooks has a $44 price target on the stock.

And it looks like the Pizookie Meal Deal isn't the only bargain associated with BJ's. The stock is trading for less than 15 times 2026 earnings estimates, a discount to rivals such as Olive Garden owner Darden Restaurants, Texas Roadhouse, CAVA Group, and Wingstop — not to mention Chipotle.

So who needs a quesadilla with beans and rice when you can have a burger and Pizookie instead? Shares of BJ's Restaurants could get a further boost from its signature value deal.

Write to Paul R. La Monica at paul.lamonica@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: W. Africa Crude-Steady as freight, geopolitics play out
data.description:
West African crude oil differentials were steady on Friday as traders digested sellers' higher offer levels, as well as fluctuating freight rates and the extent of demand from buyers looking for non-Russian crude due to Western sanctions.

* Offer levels for West African grades have risen for the December trading cycle, traders said this week, but details of actual deals at higher differentials were scarce.

* Freight rates have been fluctuating this week, affecting arbitrage economics to Asia, and the fluctuation has contributed to keeping differentials steady, a trader said.

* Traders are still awaiting clarity on the impact of the latest round of Western sanctions on Russian and whether buyers of Russian crudes will look for alternatives such as West African grades.

* In the last known Asian buying tender, Indian Oil Corp purchased 2 million barrels of West African crude from Exxon Mobil via a tender on Wednesday, taking Mondo from Angola and Utapate from Nigeria.

* Angolan Olombendo crude was last heard on offer at dated Brent plus $1.10, a trader said on Tuesday.

data.title: Stifel CEO Bats Down Report Company is For Sale — Barrons.com
data.description:
By Andrew Welsch

Stifel CEO Ron Kruszewski wants to be clear: His company isn't for sale. Kruszewski told employees just that in a memo on Wednesday, stating that a recent news article that said the company would consider a sale to a rival was "ridiculous and misleading."

Kruszewski's comments come a week after he was asked by BMO Capital Markets analyst Brennan Hawken during an earnings call if he would consider selling the company given that it is an "attractive asset." Kruszewski said no, Stifel is in a good position and gaining market share. "I'm not looking to do anything," he said.

Stifel's third-quarter results, issued last week, beat Wall Street estimates thanks to a surge of stock trading and dealmaking.

The Oct. 29 article by Wealthmanagement.com, which cited anonymous sources, said that Stifel would consider a sale to larger rival Raymond James Financial. Stifel and Raymond James have market capitalizations of approximately $12 billion and $31 billion, respectively. Both companies have wealth management and investment banking businesses.

Kruszewski expressed confidence in his company's strategy. "Stifel isn't being sold to Raymond James or to anyone else," he wrote in the memo. "I know the folks at Raymond James. They're a nice company, but let's be honest, I believe Stifel is number one. We have the best business model, the best culture, and the best team on the Street."

Shares of St. Louis-based Stifel are up 11% this year compared with a 17% gain for the S&P 500. Shares of Raymond James are up 1.7% this year.

A spokesman for Raymond James declined to comment.

On Oct. 27, Stifel agreed to sell its small independent financial advisor unit to Equitable Holdings. The unit has more than 110 independent advisors managing approximately $9 billion in client assets. The companies didn't disclose terms of the deal. Most of Stifel's advisors are employees of the firm and the sale didn't affect them. The company had $544 billion in client assets as of the end of the third quarter.

Stifel has also been in the news lately as it continues to settle cases tied to former broker Chuck Roberts. The company has reached settlements or been ordered to pay arbitration awards of more than $184 million in connection with Roberts, according to his record in BrokerCheck, an online database maintained by industry self-regulatory organization Finra.

Kruszewski has been CEO of Stifel since 1997. He has grown the company's investment banking and wealth management businesses through organic growth and a series of acquisitions.

Write to Andrew Welsch at andrew.welsch@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

About Picton

Established in 2005, Picton is listed on the main market of the London Stock Exchange and is a constituent of a number of EPRA indices including the FTSE EPRA Nareit Global Index.

Picton owns and actively manages a £726 million UK commercial property portfolio, invested across 47 assets and with around 350 occupiers (as at 30 June 2025).

Through an occupier focused, opportunity led approach, Picton aims to be the consistently best performing diversified UK REIT and has delivered upper quartile outperformance and a consistently higher income return than the MSCI UK Quarterly Property Index since launch. 

With a portfolio strategically positioned to capture income and capital growth, currently weighted towards the industrial sector, Picton's agile business model provides flexibility to adapt to evolving market trends over the long-term.

Picton has a responsible approach to business and is committed to being net zero carbon by 2040.

data.title: Proto Labs Inc SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Proto Labs Inc, a leading provider of digital manufacturing services, has released its Form 10-Q report for the third quarter of 2025. The report highlights the company's financial and operational performance, showcasing growth in key areas despite some challenges. This summary provides an overview of the financial metrics and business activities that defined Proto Labs' performance during this period.

Financial Highlights

  • Total Revenue: $135.4 million, increased by 7.8% compared to the same period in 2024, driven by an increase in average order value for larger United States customers.
  • Gross Profit: $61.3 million, increased by 7.1% compared to the same period in 2024, with a slight decrease in gross margin from 45.6% to 45.3%.
  • Income from Operations: $8.8 million, a slight increase of 2.7% compared to the same period in 2024, reflecting higher revenue volumes.
  • Net Income: $7.2 million, remained relatively stable with a slight increase of 0.4% compared to the same period in 2024.
  • Net Income Per Share (Basic): $0.30, consistent with the same period in 2024.
  • Net Income Per Share (Diluted): $0.30, consistent with the same period in 2024.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company's revenue is divided into four main product lines: Injection Molding, CNC Machining, 3D Printing, and Sheet Metal. CNC Machining saw a significant increase of 18.2% in revenue for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to the same period in 2024. Injection Molding and Sheet Metal also experienced growth, while 3D Printing revenue decreased by 6.3%.
  • Geographical Performance: The United States segment experienced a 9.8% increase in revenue for the three months ended September 30, 2025, compared to the same period in 2024, driven by higher average order values. In contrast, the European segment saw a slight decrease of 0.2% in revenue, although it was positively impacted by foreign currency movements.
  • Sales Units: During the three months ended September 30, 2025, the company served 21,252 unique customer contacts, a decrease of 5.6% from the same period in 2024. Despite the decrease in customer contacts, revenue per customer contact increased by 14.1%, indicating a strategic focus on larger orders.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue expanding its product offerings and enhancing its e-commerce interface technology. It is also focused on increasing its customer base and growing revenue through strategic marketing and sales efforts. The closure of certain manufacturing facilities in Germany is expected to be completed during fiscal year 2025, with services being fulfilled through internal facilities and a network of partners.

SEC Filing: Proto Labs Inc [ PRLB ] - 10-Q - Oct. 31, 2025
